Why might antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky flag Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky might flag Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it includes mining software, which could potentially be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can review resources from Malwarebytes and Kaspersky to learn more about these warnings.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
